intro: Gamochaeta filaginea, commonly known as the silky gamochaeta, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are hairy and narrow, while its flowers are small and clustered in a dense, spike-like arrangement. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in various conditions.
